title: [Testing CI, do not merge] Change the build system so that ATen is a single .so with all of TH* inside it.
body_html:
[NOT READY FOR MERGE]: currently this submodules ATen to see if we can get the CI to pass with this new build. When we are happy we have to figure out a way to rewrite the repo history across pytorch and aten to preserve history of both.

This rearranges the build as the first step of getting PyTorch and ATen to be deployable as separate packages, with PyTorch depending on ATen, while moving the source of truth for ATen into the pytorch repo to allow for atomic commits.

This change (paired with build changes in zdevito/ATen#127) allows ATen to build independently and produce a single libATen.so (no more libTH.so, libTHCUNN.so, etc.). It also adds the ATen test suite to the travis tests, ensuring that the independent ATen build still works.

After the next release, the plan is to actually package ATen into a separate conda package when we deploy so that other frameworks can depend directly on ATen. In this regime the source for ATen is still in the repo, we just change the way the build works so that ATen is installed as a separate thing into the same prefix.
